facts.fact_text: France’s trade deficit widened to €4.8 billion in December 2025 from a revised €4.0 billion in November.

evidences.evidence_text: France’s trade deficit widened to €4.8 billion in December 2025 from a revised €4.0 billion in November.

facts.fact_text: Imports rose 3.0% month-on-month to €57.9 billion, led by transport equipment (+10.3%), mechanical and electronic equipment (+2.1%), and refined petroleum products (+8.0%).

evidences.evidence_text: Imports rose 3.0% month-on-month to €57.9 billion, led by transport equipment (+10.3%), mechanical and electronic equipment (+2.1%), and refined petroleum products (+8.0%).

facts.fact_text: Exports grew 1.8% to €53.1 billion, supported by mechanical and electronic equipment (+6.3%), agri-food products (+2.4%), and natural hydrocarbons (+11.1%), partially offset by declines in refined petroleum products (-10.2%), transport equipment (-2.2%), and agricultural products (-2.5%).

evidences.evidence_text: Exports grew 1.8% to €53.1 billion, supported by mechanical and electronic equipment (+6.3%), agri-food products (+2.4%), and natural hydrocarbons (+11.1%), partially offset by declines in refined petroleum products (-10.2%), transport equipment (-2.2%), and agricultural products (-2.5%).

facts.fact_text: For the full year, the trade gap narrowed slightly to €69.6 billion from €79.0 billion in 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: For the full year, the trade gap narrowed slightly to €69.6 billion from €79.0 billion in 2024.

evidence.evidence_text: France’s trade deficit widened to €4.8 billion in December 2025 from a revised €4.0 billion in November.
